race.name: LITTLE SUGAR MTB
race.tagline: 62 miles of Ozark limestone singletrack that'll humble your tires and test your soul in America's mountain biking capital.

length.explanation: 100K (61.7 miles) places this solidly in the mid-range marathon category. Substantial but not ultra-distance, though the technical nature makes every mile count double.

technicality.explanation: Nearly pure singletrack with rock gardens, The Ledges section that sounds like riding on glass, sharp Ozark limestone, switchbacks, roots, and exposure. This is as technical as marathon MTB gets.

elevation.explanation: 6,558-7,000 feet of climbing delivered as death by 1000 cuts - relentless punchy efforts with no sustained climbs to find rhythm. Mentally and physically devastating.

climate.explanation: October Arkansas is a wildcard - 2023 brought 50F rain, 2024 was unseasonably hot and dusty. Average highs of 72F are ideal, but conditions are unpredictable and trail surface changes dramatically with weather.

altitude.explanation: Bentonville sits at roughly 1,300 feet elevation. No altitude concerns whatsoever - this race tests your legs and skills, not your ability to breathe thin air.

logistics.explanation: XNA Regional Airport is nearby, but race week during Big Sugar Classic means hotels book up fast at premium rates. Plan months ahead. Point-to-point format adds transport complexity.

adventure.explanation: World-class trail systems (Coler, Slaughter Pen, Back 40), fall foliage, caves, waterfalls, bluff lines, and a downtown Bentonville finish. The mountain biking capital delivers an epic experience.

prestige.explanation: Life Time Grand Prix event #5 of 6, Leadville Trail 100 MTB qualifier, $30,000 prize purse. This is where the world's best marathon MTB racers throw down in October.

race_quality.explanation: Life Time production quality with well-stocked aid stations, proper course marking (GPS still recommended), packet pickup expo, and festival week integration. Professional execution.

experience.explanation: Authentic Ozark singletrack through three legendary trail systems, fall colors, unique rock features, and finishing on Bentonville's downtown square. Memorable, challenging, character-building.

community.explanation: Bentonville is the self-proclaimed Mountain Biking Capital of the World - and the infrastructure backs it up. Bike racks at restaurants, cars yield to cyclists, trails minutes from downtown. The culture is legendary.

field_depth.explanation: Life Time Grand Prix brings the heavyweights: Keegan Swenson, Christopher Blevins, Matt Beers, Haley Batten, Sofia Gomez Villafane. Elite field with LTGP overall standings on the line.

value.explanation: $160 for the 100K is premium but includes world-class trails, Leadville qualifier opportunity, professional support, and festival week access. Worth it for the caliber of event.

expenses.explanation: Moderate total cost - race entry $160, flights to XNA reasonable, but hotels spike during race week ($80-240/night). Budget $600-1000 for the full experience. Book lodging early.

distances.name: 100K
distances.description: The flagship distance - nearly pure singletrack through Coler, Back 40, and Slaughter Pen. Leadville Trail 100 MTB qualifier.

distances.name: 50K
distances.description: Intermediate distance covering the best of Bentonville's trail systems. Perfect for Semi-Sweet challenge pairing with Big Sugar 50-mile gravel.

distances.name: 20K
distances.description: Beginner-friendly intro to the Ozark singletrack experience.

race.terrain: Sharp Ozark limestone singletrack, rock gardens, punchy climbs, technical descents, roots, switchbacks, The Ledges, bluff lines, caves, and flow sections. Almost entirely off-road.

weather.conditions: Variable - can be hot/dusty or cold/rainy. October Arkansas is unpredictable.
